2025-12-11TCCanada Shipping Act, 2001Regulations Amending the Small Vessel RegulationsRegulations Amending the Small Vessel Regulations in order to (1) introduce a $24 service fee for the issuance, renewal, or transfer of a pleasure craft licences (PCL); (2) establish a five-year validity period for all PCLs, gradually expire lifetime PCLs, expand the Minister’s authority to cancel a PCL for non-compliance; (3) expand the scope of PCL requirements to include wind-powered vessels above six meters in length such as sail-alone vessels; (4) set clearer requirements and timelines for the transfer of PCLs; (5) reduce the timeframe for PCL holders to notify Transport Canada of changes to licence information from 90 days to 30 days; and (6) require vessel manufacturers, builders, and importers to notify Transport Canada of any changes in their contact information within 30 days.Registration: SOR/2025-0272 Publication Date: 2025-12-31
subject: Regulations Amending the Small Vessel Regulations
precis: Regulations Amending the Small Vessel Regulations in order to (1) introduce a $24 service fee for the issuance, renewal, or transfer of a pleasure craft licences (PCL); (2) establish a five-year validity period for all PCLs, gradually expire lifetime PCLs, expand the Minister’s authority to cancel a PCL for non-compliance; (3) expand the scope of PCL requirements to include wind-powered vessels above six meters in length such as sail-alone vessels; (4) set clearer requirements and timelines for the transfer of PCLs; (5) reduce the timeframe for PCL holders to notify Transport Canada of changes to licence information from 90 days to 30 days; and (6) require vessel manufacturers, builders, and importers to notify Transport Canada of any changes in their contact information within 30 days.
